description.narrative: Support sustainable reintegration of Iraqi refugees and internally displaced persons, and specifically, persons formerly associated with ISIL.

activity-description.narrative: The C2RI project works in Anbar, Salah al Din, and Ninewa governorates.
The C2RI project works in Anbar, Salah al Din, and Ninewa governorates.
The C2RI project works in Anbar, Salah al Din, and Ninewa governorates.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1 – Adults formerly associated and selected community members have received targeted reintegration support.
1.1 - # of men and women benefited from cash for work activities, age disaggregated. 1.2 - # of men and women received demand-driven vocational training and facilitation of access to sustainable employment, age disaggregated 1.3 - # of men and women provided with business training and SME grants, age disaggregated 1.4 - % of beneficiaries reported positive changes (e.g. access to health, education, food), gender and age disaggregated. 1.5 - % of increase in household's income of the beneficiary, gender and age disaggregated. 1.6 - # of men and women received Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Services (MHPSS), age disaggregated. 1.7 - # of men and women supported by Information, Counselling and Referral System, age disaggregated 1.8 - # of houses of community members and persons formerly associated with ISIL rehabilitated.
Output 2 - Increased community acceptance in the selected areas for the return and reintegration of children, young people and adults formerly associated.
2.1 - # of LPC supported and implemented social cohesion activities 2.2 - % of community members reported positive change towards acceptance of return and reintegration 2.3 - # of social and productive infrastructure rehabilitated by UNDP under the project in use. 2.4 - # of social and PVE activities held in the targeted locations.
Output 3 - National institutions, policies and strategies for reintegration strengthened and developed.
3.1 - # Roadmap / Policy / Strategy on Reconciliation and Reintegration formulated. 3.2 - # of government staff trained on priority skills/knowledge requirements, disaggregated by gender and age.
Output 4 - Local institutions and governance structures for reintegration strengthened.
4.1 - # of LPCs that have successfully facilitated the return of persons formerly associated. 4.2 - # of UNDP supported inclusive community level mechanisms for

Output 1 – Adults formerly associated and selected community members have received targeted reintegration support.
1.1 - 1,800 men and women benefited from cash for work activities, age disaggregated. 1.2 - 600 men and women received demand-driven vocational training and facilitation of access to sustainable employment, age disaggregated 1.3 - 200 men and women provided with business training and SME grants, age disaggregated 1.4 - 60% of beneficiaries reported positive changes (e.g. access to health, education, food), gender and age disaggregated. 1.5 - TBD% of increase in households income of the beneficiary, gender and age disaggregated (after establishing baseline) 1.6 - 800 men and women received Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Services (MHPSS), age disaggregated. 1.7 - 400 men and women supported by Information, Counselling and Referral System, age disaggregated 1.8 - 500 houses of community members and persons formerly associated with ISIL rehabilitated.
Output 2 - Increased community acceptance in the selected areas for the return and reintegration of children, young people and adults formerly associated.
2.1 - 4 LPCs supported and implemented social cohesion activities 2.2 - 70% of community members reported positive change towards acceptance of return and reintegration 2.3 - 15 social and productive infrastructure rehabilitated by UNDP under the project in use. 2.4 - 20 social and PVE activities held in the targeted locations.
Output 3 - National institutions, policies and strategies for reintegration strengthened and developed.
3.1 - 1 Roadmap / Policy / Strategy on Reconciliation and Reintegration formulated. 3.2 - 20 government staff trained on priority skills/knowledge requirements, disaggregated by gender and age.
Output 4 - Local institutions and governance structures for reintegration strengthened.
4.1 - 4 LPCs that have successfully facilitated the return of persons formerly associated. 4.2 - 8 UNDP supported inclusive community level mechanisms for conflict resolution and consensus that facilitate the return of persons formerly associated.

Output 1 – Adults formerly associated and selected community members have received targeted reintegration support.
1.1 - 0 men and women benefited from cash for work activities, age disaggregated. 1.2 - 0 men and women received demand-driven vocational training and facilitation of access to sustainable employment, age disaggregated 1.3 - 0 men and women provided with business training and SME grants, age disaggregated 1.4 - N/A% of beneficiaries reported positive changes (e.g. access to health, education, food), gender and age disaggregated. 1.5 - TBD% of increase in households income of the beneficiary, gender and age disaggregated (after establishing baseline) 1.6 - 209 men and women received Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Services (160 men, 49 women, 43 youth) 1.7 - 0 men and women supported by Information, Counselling and Referral System, age disaggregated 1.8 - 18 houses of community members and persons formerly associated with ISIL rehabilitated.
Output 2 - Increased community acceptance in the selected areas for the return and reintegration of children, young people and adults formerly associated.
2.1 - 21 LPCs and 4 CDCs supported and continue to hold consultative meetings in their communities and support the return of families. 2.2 - N/A% of community members reported positive change towards acceptance of return and reintegration 2.3 - 0 social and productive infrastructure rehabilitated by UNDP under the project in use. 2.4 - 0 social and PVE activities held in the targeted locations.
Output 3 - National institutions, policies and strategies for reintegration strengthened and developed.
3.1 - 0 Roadmap / Policy / Strategy on Reconciliation and Reintegration formulated. Discussions are still ongoing. 3.2 - 100 government staff and security officials trained on providing reintegration support (98 men, 2 women).
Output 4 - Local institutions and governance structures for reintegration strengthened.
4.1 - 3 LPCs that have successfully facilitated the return of persons formerly associated. 4.2 - 21 LPCs and 4 CDCs are functional and supported by UNDP for conflict resolution and consensus that facilitate the return of persons formerly associated.
